description: Iraq invaded Kuwait leading to the Gulf War and major disruption in global oil supply
Terrorist attacks in the United States increased geopolitical risk and uncertainty in global markets
US-led invasion of Iraq affected oil production and exports from a major oil-producing country
Brent oil prices reached record highs due to strong demand and supply constraints
Global recession caused a sharp decline in oil demand and prices
Civil war in Libya disrupted oil production and exports
OPEC decided not to cut production resulting in a prolonged oil price collapse
Lifting of international sanctions allowed Iran to re-enter global oil markets
OPEC and partners agreed on coordinated production cuts to stabilize prices
United States reimposed sanctions on Iran reducing its oil exports
Saudi Arabia and Russia engaged in a price war causing a sharp fall in oil prices
COVID-19 demand collapse and storage shortages led to negative oil prices
OPEC+ agreed to record production cuts to stabilize collapsing prices
Post-pandemic demand surge combined with supply constraints increased energy prices
Russian invasion of Ukraine disrupted global energy supply chains
Sanctions on Russian energy exports intensified global supply concerns
